title: Static Website Magic: Building TechImbue.com with Claude Code, GitHub, and Cloudflare Pages
author: Anindya Roy
excerpt: How I built a professional business website in hours (not weeks) using AI-powered development, version control, and free hosting. Zero cost, zero build tools, maximum impact.

content.text: Building a professional business website typically takes weeks of development, design iterations, and deployment configurations. What if I told you it could be done in hours — with zero hosting costs, zero build tools, and AI handling the entire development workflow?
That's exactly how TechImbue.com came to life. The secret? A powerful combination of three technologies: Anthropic's Claude Code, GitHub, and Cloudflare Pages. Static website magic, indeed.
The Stack: Three Tools, Zero Cost
Let me break down this incredibly efficient development stack:

items: Claude Code (Anthropic): AI-powered development assistant that writes HTML, CSS, JavaScript, handles git operations, and manages the entire development workflow through natural language
GitHub: Version control and repository hosting (free for public repos)
Cloudflare Pages: Lightning-fast global CDN hosting with automatic deployments (free tier is generous)

content.text: Total monthly cost? $0. Total build tools required? Zero. Time to deploy? Minutes.
How Claude Code Transformed the Workflow

Traditional web development involves juggling multiple tools, writing boilerplate code, debugging CSS, configuring build systems, and wrestling with deployment pipelines. Claude Code eliminated all of that.
Here's what Claude Code handled autonomously:

items: Design & Development: Created a modern glassmorphism design with dark monochrome theme and gold accents — matching TechImbue's brand identity perfectly
Responsive Layout: Built mobile-first responsive design with proper breakpoints for tablet and desktop
Interactive Features: Implemented smooth scrolling, intersection observers for scroll animations, modal systems, mobile menu, and parallax effects
SEO Optimization: Added comprehensive meta tags, Open Graph data, Twitter cards, and Schema.org structured data
Git Management: Initialized repository, created commits with proper messages, and pushed to GitHub
Blog System: Built a JSON-based blog with dynamic rendering (no build tools!)
Content Integration: Structured all service offerings, client showcases, founder bio, and book promotion sections

content.text: The Pure Static Approach
One of the best decisions was keeping everything pure static — no React, no Vue, no build pipeline, no webpack, no npm hell. Just clean HTML5, CSS3, and vanilla JavaScript (ES6+).
Why? Because simplicity scales better than complexity:

items: Performance: No framework overhead = blazing fast load times
Reliability: No dependencies to break or become outdated
Maintainability: Any developer can read and modify the code
SEO: Real HTML, real content, search engines love it
Hosting: Deploy anywhere, no special requirements

content.text: The blog system? It's JSON-based. Posts are stored in posts.json, and JavaScript dynamically renders them. Want to add a new post? Edit the JSON, commit, push. Done. No markdown processors, no static site generators, no build step.
Cloudflare Pages: The Deployment Dream
Cloudflare Pages might be the most underrated developer tool out there. Here's what you get on the free tier:

items: Global CDN with edge caching (your site loads fast everywhere)
Automatic deployments from GitHub (push = deploy)
Unlimited bandwidth (seriously)
Free SSL certificates (automatic HTTPS)
Custom domains (no extra cost)
Atomic deployments (instant rollback if needed)
Preview deployments for branches

content.text: Setup time? Connect GitHub repository, click deploy, done. No configuration files, no build commands (we're pure static), no environment variables to manage.

content.caption: Watch the full workflow demonstration: Claude Code + GitHub + Cloudflare Pages in action (3:05)

content.text: The Development Experience
Working with Claude Code felt less like traditional programming and more like collaborating with an expert developer who gets it. I described what I wanted in plain English:

Create a modern website for TechImbue showcasing infrastructure consultancy, cybersecurity, and AI services. Dark theme with gold accents. Glassmorphism effects. Make it look premium and tech-forward.
Claude Code understood the requirements, made design decisions, implemented best practices, and delivered production-ready code. When I wanted changes, I just asked:

items: "Add a blog section with JSON-based posts"
"Make the hero section more interactive with tech cards"
"Add my book promotion with a standout design"
"Fix the mobile menu bug where it disappears after multiple clicks"

content.text: Every request was handled correctly, with proper error handling, accessibility considerations, and performance optimization. The AI even wrote proper git commit messages explaining what changed and why.
What This Means for Businesses
This workflow has profound implications for businesses, especially tech consultancies and startups:

items: Speed to Market: Launch professional websites in hours, not weeks
Zero Operating Costs: Free hosting, free SSL, free CDN, unlimited bandwidth
AI-Powered Iteration: Want to change something? Just ask. No hourly rates, no agency fees
Full Control: You own the code, the repo, the deployment. No vendor lock-in
Easy Maintenance: Add blog posts by editing JSON. Update content with simple HTML changes
Professional Results: Modern design, proper SEO, fast performance, mobile-responsive

content.text: For a technology consultancy like TechImbue, this demonstrates exactly what we preach: practical innovation that delivers real business value.
The Technical Details
For those interested in the technical architecture:

items: Tech Stack: HTML5, CSS3, Vanilla JavaScript (ES6+)
Design System: CSS custom properties for theming, glassmorphism effects with backdrop-filter
Animations: Intersection Observer API for scroll-triggered animations, CSS transforms for performance
Blog System: JSON data store + JavaScript renderer, no build tools
SEO: Complete meta tags, Schema.org structured data, semantic HTML
Hosting: Cloudflare Pages with edge caching and automatic deployments
Version Control: GitHub repository with atomic commits

content.text: The entire codebase is clean, commented, and follows modern web standards. No hacks, no workarounds, no technical debt.
Lessons Learned
After deploying TechImbue.com this way, here are my key takeaways:

items: AI-powered development is ready for production: Claude Code produces quality code that follows best practices
Simplicity beats complexity: Pure static sites are faster, more reliable, and easier to maintain than framework-heavy SPAs
Free doesn't mean limited: Cloudflare Pages' free tier is production-grade
Iteration speed matters: Being able to ask for changes in natural language accelerates development massively
Documentation is critical: I created CLAUDE.md to help future AI instances work on the codebase efficiently

content.text: Try It Yourself
Want to build your own site this way? Here's the workflow:

items: Get access to Claude Code (claude.ai/code)
Create a GitHub repository
Describe your website to Claude Code in natural language
Let it build, test, and commit the code
Connect your GitHub repo to Cloudflare Pages
Deploy (automatic from every push)

content.text: That's it. No webpack configs, no package.json, no build scripts, no deployment YAML files. Just clean code and smart automation.
The Future of Web Development
This approach represents where web development is heading: AI handles the implementation details while humans focus on vision, strategy, and content.

Instead of spending days wrestling with CSS grid bugs or configuring webpack loaders, I spent my time on what matters: defining TechImbue's message, structuring our service offerings, and creating compelling content.
The technical execution? Claude Code handled it flawlessly.

This is just the beginning. At TechImbue, we're exploring how AI-powered development workflows can transform not just websites, but entire infrastructure deployments, automation pipelines, and business operations. Want to bring this approach to your organization? Let's talk.

title: Running 70B Models Across Two AMD Strix Halo Boxes: Early Results from Distributed AI Research
author: Anindya Roy
excerpt: Two days of effort — very early results, but I'm genuinely excited about the possibilities. Successfully running a 70B parameter dense model across two AMD Strix Halo boxes connected via USB4/Thunderbolt 4.

content.text: Two days of effort — very early results, but I'm genuinely excited about the possibilities.

I've successfully run a 70B parameter dense model across two AMD Strix Halo boxes (96GB VRAM each) connected via USB4/Thunderbolt 4 using P2P (peer-to-peer) connection. This is cutting-edge distributed AI inference at the edge.
What's Working

items: Dense transformer models running stably across the distributed setup
USB4/Thunderbolt 4 P2P connection providing sufficient bandwidth
96GB VRAM per box enabling large model handling
Successful load balancing across both AMD GPUs

content.text: Current Challenges

items: MoE (Mixture of Experts) architectures failing at load time
Further optimization needed for multi-box coordination
Testing required for various model architectures

content.text: What's Next

A research paper documenting these findings is forthcoming. The next phase of this research involves daisy-chaining four Strix Halo units together, which would enable running full-size DeepSeek and Llama models at the edge without cloud dependencies.
This work has significant implications for:

items: Privacy-first AI: Running large models entirely on-premise
Edge Computing: Bringing frontier model capabilities to local infrastructure
Cost Efficiency: Eliminating cloud API costs for production AI workloads
Latency Reduction: Local inference for real-time applications

content.caption: Watch the demonstration of distributed inference running across two AMD Strix Halo boxes (2:48)

This research aligns with TechImbue's mission of delivering privacy-first, on-premise AI solutions that give organizations complete control over their data and infrastructure.
